title: Patriots DT Milton Williams misses practice with ankle injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Williams was a limited participant on Wednesday before being downgraded to out on Thursday.

Milton Williams John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe FOXBOROUGH — Patriots defensive tackle Milton Williams did not participate in practice on Wednesday, popping up on the injury report with an ankle injury.
Williams was a limited participant on Wednesday before being downgraded to out on Thursday.

title: Josh McDaniels gave a humorous response to Stefon Diggs’ ‘5 out of 10’ comment
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Diggs was being modest about how comfortable he is within the Patriots' offense, McDaniels said.

Stefon Diggs and Josh McDaniels AP Photo/Charles Krupa FOXBOROUGH — Stefon Diggs took a humble approach to a question about how comfortable he is within the Patriots’ offense after his first 100-yard game of the season on Sunday.
“Five out of 10,” he said, shrugging his shoulders.

title: Is Drake Maye ready for prime time? Sunday night will be his first real chance to show it.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "It's always a little extra juice playing primetime," Maye said.
Drake Maye AP Photo/Charles Krupa ShareSend this article to your social connections.

ESPN NFL analyst explained why Patriots are a ‘dangerous’ matchup for Bills in Week 5 Buffalo Bills to debut their ‘Cold Front’ uniforms Sunday night against the Patriots FOXBOROUGH — The last time we saw Drake Maye in prime time was his NFL debut on a Thursday night last September.

title: Beloved Dennis breakfast spot Grumpy’s hits the market after 35 years
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The Route 6A institution has drawn summer crowds for decades with classics like corned beef hash, grilled muffins, omelettes, and pancakes.
A view of Grumpy's along Route 6A in East Dennis.

title: Body from unsolved 1974 murder exhumed from North Shore cemetery
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime “What happened to Henry has never left this town.
" Henry Bedard, and the baseball bat that was found at the scene.
Swampscott Police Department A body was exhumed Wednesday from a cemetery in relation to the unsolved murder of a 15-year-old Swampscott boy in 1974.

title: ‘They just wanted to laugh’: Bill Burr defends performing at Saudi comedy festival
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Celebs Bill Burr was among several high-profile comedians who traveled to Saudi Arabia to perform at the Riyadh Comedy Festival, including Kevin Hart, Dave Chappelle, Louis C.
K.

title: Here are the initial prices for Boston World Cup tickets at Gillette Stadium
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Sports News The first tickets went on sale for those who were chosen in FIFA's Visa presale draw.
The FIFA World Cup Boston 2026 logo on display at Gillette Stadium in June.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Hayden Bird October 2, 2025 | 2:16 PM 2 minutes to read After prolonged speculation, fans are starting to get a glimpse at what the cost of attending world soccer’s most celebrated event will be when it returns to North America in 2026.

title: Buffalo Bills to debut their ‘Cold Front’ uniforms Sunday night against the Patriots
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: New England Patriots "The city's DNA stitched into fabric.
" Bills vs Patriots on January 5, 2025 (Barry Chin/Globe Staff).
The Buffalo Bills are hoping for an early winter as they give fans a first look at their new “Cold Front” uniforms this Sunday against the Patriots.
